title: Electric force - acceleration of 1 of 3 spheres

content.question: Three small, charged spheres are initially all fixed in place at the relative positions indicated in the figure. The sphere on the left has a charge <math alttext="negative Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math>, while the other two spheres each have a charge <math alttext="positive Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math>. The sphere on the right is then released from rest. Gravitational forces are negligible. Which of the following claims best describes the motion of the released sphere?

choices.label: It travels to the right with a constant acceleration.
It travels to the right with an acceleration that decreases in magnitude.
It travels to the left with a constant acceleration.
It travels to the left with an acceleration that increases in magnitude.

content.answer: It travels to the right with an acceleration that decreases in magnitude.

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
